Title: LISTEN // HEAR Ep. 1 Beethoven's Symphony No. 9
Description:
Donate now to the Symphony’s Stabilization Fund and your new or increased gift will be matched dollar for dollar. Help keep the music playing for everyone!
Click here to donate: https://tinyurl.com/yyl7c3tv 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A new digital series: LISTEN // HEAR featuring Music Director Rafael Payare and his colleagues from the San Diego Symphony, together with our London-based Creative Consultant, Gerard McBurney, discussing highlights of the symphonic repertoire. This week's guest speakers are Jeremy Kurtz-Harris, principal bass, and Douglas Hall, horn.

These weekly virtual gatherings will be live-streamed on YouTube and Facebook every Wednesday evening and available for on-demand viewing afterward. 

In our first episode, we tackle one of the loftiest peaks of the art form: Beethoven’s Symphony No. 9.

Title: LISTEN // HEAR Ep. 4  Tchaikovsky's Pathétique Symphony
Description:
Donate now to the Symphony’s Stabilization Fund and your new or increased gift will be matched dollar for dollar. Help keep the music playing for everyone!

Tune in live on Facebook or YouTube Wednesday, July 8 at 6:30PM for Episode 4 of LISTEN // HEAR featuring Music Director Rafael Payare and our London-based Creative Consultant, Gerard McBurney.

In Episode 4, we explore Tchaikovsky’s "Pathétique" Symphony with San Diego Symphony musicians Kyle Covington, principal trombone and Yao Zhao, principal cello.

Title: Rafael Payare conducts Berlioz’s Symphonie fantastique
Description:
Download the concert programme: https://www.rcm.ac.uk/included/eventimages/programmes/Symphonie%20fantastique%20-%20concert%20programme.pdf

Rafael Payare - conductor 
Magdalene Ho - piano 
RCM Symphony Orchestra 

Programme:
Carlos Simon - Fate Now Conquers 
Beethoven - Piano Concerto no 1 in C major op15 
Berlioz - Symphonie fantastique

Rafael Payare is at the helm for a spellbinding RCM Symphony Orchestra concert, featuring Berlioz’s dramatic and passionate Symphonie fantastique as well Carlos Simon’s piece inspired by an entry in Beethoven’s journal, ’Fate Now Conquers’, and Beethoven’s First Piano Concerto performed by Magdalene Ho.

Berlioz was a Romantic through and through, and the young man at the heart of the Symphonie fantastique’s story might have been the composer himself, his obsessive nature represented by a recurring motif or ’ideé fixe’. In the opening ’Reveries, Passions’, Berlioz conjures up what he called ’volcanic love’, followed by a waltzing ball scene and pastoral interlude. Then come the sinister ’March to the Scaffold’ and nightmarish ’Dream of a Witches’ Sabbath’, reflecting what Berlioz described as the key elements of his style: ’passionate expression, inner warmth, rhythmic impetus and unexpectedness’.

To browse the Royal College of Music’s events season, visit https://www.rcm.ac.uk/events

Title: RCM Symphony Orchestra: Rafael Payare conducts Skryabin Poema Ekastaza
Description:
Find out more about the Royal College of Music at http://www.rcm.ac.uk

Guest conductor Rafael Payare leads the RCM Symphony Orchestra in a performance of Skryabin’s symphonic poem, written in the early 20th century. The composer wrote a poem over three hundred lines long to accompany the music, though not to be recited with it. The poem tracks the ascent of a spirit into consciousness, catalysed by the recurring appearance of ‘trembling presentiments of dark rhythms’ that later transform into ‘bright presentiments of shining rhythms.’ 

Recorded on 13 January 2019 in the Amaryllis Fleming Concert Hall at the Royal College of Music in London.
